intro: Gnaphalium ecuadorense var. boliviense, commonly known as the Bolivian feather grass, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia and Ecuador. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces small, fluffy white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow, linear, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is often found in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, mountainous climates of its native range.
